item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ThatOneServer, post:14, topic:83456”][quote author=Mod Taharok link=topic=122636.msg1201213#msg1201213 date=1177290869]
Why not have everyone load off of a SQL database just like regular forums?
[/quote]

  1. I know nothing if SQL
  2. I like txt files
  3. You can host the client virtually anywhere[/quote]

Well, if you ever plan on running the server part of the forums on an actual server, for efficiency reasons you should make everything save in a SQL Database instead of text documents. It is faster and more convenient.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Here is how i see it. This is the directory tree:

Directory ForumTree // Categories
--Categories.txt // lists boards name... used to load them
--Directory Announcements // Announcements Category -- loaded from announcements.txt
----Boards.txt // Lists Board Names... used to load them
----Properties.txt // Category Properties Not sure exactly what it will load
----Directory News // News Board -- loaded from boards.txt
------properties.txt // Board Properties. . . Not sure exactly what will go here
------Directory Topics // All of the topics of the board. . . This folder name is NOT loaded
--------1.txt // First Thread Ever(Last In List)
--------TopicCount.txt // Used to order the topics
--------Directory Stickied // Stickied Topics Go Here
----------1.txt                 //Every File In Here Has The
----------STopicCount.txt // Same Properties As the Above Ones.

Here is the syntax for the shit

%*%Name The Name Of The Thread %*%User Topic Owner's Name %*%Replies 1 %*%Properties Open %*%StartTopic This is the body of the thread. %*%EndTopic %*%Reply 1 %*%User User That Replied %*%StartReply Reply Message %*%EndReply

NOTE: Users will not be able to have %*% in their thread

Read full topic

item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“ThatOneServer, post:1, topic:83456”]Well, Runescape servers seem to be restricted and dull. I like working on java projects, and this one is going to be a big one. I am making a forum from java. It works with a server and a client, here is a picture of the server GUI:

server.jpg698×302

and here is the client:

It will be composed mostly of JButtons and JLabels, Maybe some JTextAreas.

Here is what I have for the Server:
GUI(just a JTextArea with a void that appends text, Replaces system.out.println
Login(processing)

Here is what I Have for the Client:
GUI
Login
LoginText

I just started this yesterday night, so I havent gotten much progress(As of the time this thread was created)[/quote]

Call me Grundy, but it looks like a cheaper version of irc?

Read full topic
